<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;94ea9fa.1502">   <title>CALL FOR SPEAKERS/TUTORS: ASSESS SPSS USERS MEETING IN YORK ON FRIDAY 30TH OCTOBER </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;94ea9fa.1502</link>   <description> 29TH ANNUAL ONE-DAY CONFERENCE, FRIDAY 30TH OCTOBER 2015<br>ARRC, UNIVERSITY OF YORK, YORK, UK<br><br>Our SPSS users meeting is provisionally set to go ahead on Friday 30th October 2015. Would you like to be involved?<br><br>The committee welcomes contributions on SPSS-related topics from all academic and professional fields, particularly software demonstrations<br>and case studies (in areas such as medicine, marketing, business, government and the environment) illustrating applications in SPSS including interpretation<br>of any output, using graphics in SPSS such as SPSS Chart Builder, practical SPSS syntax tips, GIS Maps, customising tables, statistical analyses such as<br>multilevel modelling, structural equation modelling, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T12:50:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Watson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;94ea9fa.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;92d004d4.1502">   <title>Workshop: Exploring Longterm Trends in Social Attitudes and Crime </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;92d004d4.1502</link>   <description> Exploring Longterm Trends in Social Attitudes and Crime<br><br>Wednesday 20 May 2015, 10am \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4pm<br>Computer Lab 2.88, Humanities Bridgeford Street, University of Manchester<br><br>Exploring why change takes place and the implications of both changes and stability is of growing importance for social scientists. Yet the limited availability of datasets which enable these sorts of analyses hampers efforts. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T08:12:47+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gillian Meadows</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;92d004d4.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;2196b19c.1502">   <title>A Discussion with Prof Kathy Charmaz on Grounded Theory </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;2196b19c.1502</link>   <description> List subscribers might be interested in this new video available on YouTube:<br><br>A Discussion with Prof Kathy Charmaz on Grounded Theory<br>http://youtu.be/D5AHmHQS6WQ<br><br>Graham    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-04T19:59:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>QDA and CAQDAS</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;2196b19c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d364f3be.1502">   <title>New Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice Advance Online Articles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d364f3be.1502</link>   <description> New Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice Advance Online<br>articles available.<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/cjccjAO&gt; http://bit.ly/cjccjAO<br><br>Determinants of Police Strength in Canadian Cities: Assessing the Impact of<br>Minority Threat<br><br>Rick Ruddell and Matthew O. Thomas<br><br>The minority threat proposition posits that the size of minority populations<br>is positively associated with levels of formal social control. Recent<br>research in other nations has shown a clear and consistent relationship<br>between the size of subordinate populations and the number of police as well<br>as increased law enforcement spending. This study examined the<br>relationships, in Canada's largest cities, between six indicators of<br>minority populations and both [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T13:21:01-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d364f3be.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;e15525cc.1501">   <title>University of Toronto Law Journal 65.1 is now available online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;e15525cc.1501</link>   <description> Now available online...<br><br>University of Toronto Law Journal - Volume 65, Number 1, Winter 2015<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/utlj571&gt; http://bit.ly/utlj571<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>The stripping of the trust: A study in legal evolution<br><br>Adam S Hofri-Winogradow<br><br>The law of trusts has spent the last twenty years rapidly shedding many<br>traditional requirements, forms, and restrictions which imposed liability on<br>negligent trustees, protected vulnerable beneficiaries, and prevented the<br>use of trusts to avoid the claims of settlors' and beneficiaries' creditors,<br>including their spouses, their children, and their governments. This article<br>studies seven aspects of this 'stripping of the trust,' examines its<br>consequences from both a [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-27T14:05:56-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;e15525cc.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;3f85d4.1501">   <title>Now available at University of Toronto Law Journal Advance online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;3f85d4.1501</link>   <description> Now available at University of Toronto Law Journal Advance online...<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/utljao&gt; http://bit.ly/utljao<br><br>Victim Impact Statements at Sentencing: Towards A Clearer Understanding of<br>Their Aims<br><br>Marie Manikis<br><br>The Fault of Trespass<br><br>Avihay Dorfman and Assaf Jacob<br><br>The Stripping of the Trust: A Study In Legal Evolution<br><br>Adam S Hofri-Winogradow<br><br>Living Originalism<br><br>Paul Daly<br><br>List and Pettit on Group Agency and Group Responsibility [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T15:05:32-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;3f85d4.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;912de39.1501">   <title>January UTP Journals Law & Criminology Newsletter </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;912de39.1501</link>   <description> Don't miss the January UTP Journals Law &amp; Criminology Newsletter - mailing<br>January 19!<br><br>Sign up for the free monthly UTP Journals Law and Criminology newsletter!<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/lawnewsletter&gt; http://bit.ly/lawnewsletter<br><br>Receive the latest information on newly published research, reviews and<br>opinions as well as Calls for papers, news items and exclusive discounts.<br>You can unsubscribe at any time and we will never publish, rent or sell your<br>contact details to anyone. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T14:32:23-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;912de39.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d140a441.1501">   <title>Now available on Project MUSE - Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice, January 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d140a441.1501</link>   <description> Now available on Project MUSE\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice/ La Revue canadienne de<br>criminologie et de justice p\ufffd\ufffdnale<br><br>Volume 57, Number 1, January 2015<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/cjccj571pm&gt; http://bit.ly/cjccj571pm<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>La perception du prestige des occupations illicites par des d\ufffd\ufffdlinquants<br><br>Yanick Charette<br><br>Unemployment, GDP, and Crime: The Importance of Multiple Measurements of the<br>Economy<br><br>Martin A. Andresen<br><br>Unintended Consequences of Multiple Bail Conditions for Youth [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-13T10:29:35-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d140a441.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d5adfefa.1501">   <title>UK Data Service webinar: Key data: Key surveys (national and cross-national) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d5adfefa.1501</link>   <description> Webinar: Key data: Key surveys (national and cross-national)<br><br>29 January 2015<br>Online at 3 pm<br><br>This webinar is intended for anyone who wants to know more about the UK government survey datasets and the cross-national datasets available from the UK Data Service. The UK Data Service provides access to a wide range of UK government surveys such as the British Social Attitudes Survey, the Labour Force Survey and the Crime Survey for England and Wales. We also provide access to a number of cross-national surveys such as such as the Eurobarometer surveys and the European Election Studies. These surveys cover [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T11:45:01+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gillian Meadows</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;d5adfefa.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;8d37ff96.1501">   <title>January 2015 issue of Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice now available online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;8d37ff96.1501</link>   <description> Now available online\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice/<br>La Revue canadienne de criminologie et de justice p\ufffd\ufffdnale<br><br>Volume 57, Number 1, January 2015<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/cjccj571&gt; http://bit.ly/cjccj571<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>La perception du prestige des occupations illicites par des d\ufffd\ufffdlinquants<br><br>Yanick Charette<br><br>Le prestige occupationnel est une mesure utilis\ufffd\ufffde en sociologie des<br>professions pour d\ufffd\ufffdterminer le statut social d\ufffd\ufffdun emploi sous la forme d\ufffd\ufffdun<br>continuum hi\ufffd\ufffdrarchis\ufffd\ufffd. Cette mesure peut \ufffd\ufffdtre d\ufffd\ufffdfinie selon : le revenu, le<br>niveau de supervision, l\ufffd\ufffdautonomie et les comp\ufffd\ufffdtences. En se basant sur des<br>entrevues aupr\ufffd\ufffds de d\ufffd\ufffdlinquants incarc\ufffd\ufffdr\ufffd\ufffds (n = 133), cette \ufffd\ufffdtude \ufffd\ufffdvalue si<br> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-05T13:31:41-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;8d37ff96.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;453d491c.1501">   <title>Canadian Journal of Women and the Law 26.2 now available on Project MUSE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;453d491c.1501</link>   <description> Now available on Project MUSE \ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Women and the Law/Revue Femmes et Droit<br><br>Volume 26, Number 2, October 2014<br><br>http://bit.ly/cjwl262pm<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Does the System of Judicial Appointment Matter? Exploring Women\ufffd\ufffds<br>Representation on Ontario\ufffd\ufffds Courts<br><br>Erin Crandall<br><br>Eloquent (In)action: Enforcement and Prosecutorial Restraint in the<br>Transnational Trade in Human Eggs As Deep Ambivalence about the Law [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-05T09:57:02-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;453d491c.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;5efc48ae.1412">   <title>CFP: Session "Whose right to the city?", EUGEO 2015, 30/08 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 02/09, Budapest</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;5efc48ae.1412</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Call for papers : EUGEO 2015, 30/08 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 02/09, Budapest<br>Session title: &quot;Whose right to the city?&quot;<br><br>Convened by: Margier Antonin (University of Lille 1) &amp; Lucas Melga\ufffd\ufffdo (Vrije<br>Universiteit Brussel)<br><br>At a time when people are reclaiming access to public spaces (the Occupy<br>Movement, for example), we see that the presence of all citizens in public<br>spaces is not taken for granted. Various authors have focused on the<br>emergent punitive regulation of public spaces that affects the homeless<br>(Smith, 1996; Mitchell, 1997), street vendors (Crossa, 2009), prostitutes<br>(Hubbard, 2004) and youth (Malone, 2002). Moreover, the idea [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-29T13:36:41+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lucas Melga\ufffd\ufffdo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;5efc48ae.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;76b61db2.1412">   <title>1st Call for Papers for Intl Conference on Crime and Language </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;76b61db2.1412</link>   <description> The Germanic Society for Forensic Linguistics (GSFL) is pleased to announce the first call for papers for the Third Annual Roundtable in Forensic Linguistics/Phonetics. The pupose of the GSFL is to provide researchers, teachers, and practitioners (e.g. criminologists, psychologists, sociologists, police officers, interpreters/translators, lawyers, etc.) working within forensic linguistics, the opportunity to present and discuss their work within a creative, supportive, interdisciplinary setting. Paper and poster abstracts are invited in any of the following areas: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-23T08:23:04+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>I. M. Laversuch Nick</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;76b61db2.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;aab09edb.1412">   <title>Canadian Journal of Women and the Law 26.2 now available online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;aab09edb.1412</link>   <description> Now available online \ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Women and the Law/Revue Femmes et Droit<br><br>Volume 26, Number 2, October 2014<br><br>http://bit.ly/cjwl262<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Does the System of Judicial Appointment Matter? Exploring Women\ufffd\ufffds<br>Representation on Ontario\ufffd\ufffds Courts<br><br>Erin Crandall<br><br>Using an original dataset of appointments to Ontario\ufffd\ufffds provincial and<br>superior courts from 1972 to 2012, this article explores whether the system<br>of judicial appointment affects the representation of women on the bench. In<br>addition to providing a comprehensive review of judicial appointments in<br>Ontario, the article finds that since the introduction of new judicial<br>appointments systems by the federal and [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-19T10:20:36-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;aab09edb.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;f409e64a.1412">   <title>CALL FOR AUTHORS: SAGE Reference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;f409e64a.1412</link>   <description> CALL FOR AUTHORS: The SAGE Encyclopedia of Surveillance, Security, and Privacy<br><br>We are inviting academic editorial contributors to The SAGE<br>Encyclopedia of Surveillance, Security, and Privacy, a new 4-volume<br>reference. Although surveillance has been dominating headlines with<br>revelations by Edward Snowden that the NSA has been tracking phone<br>calls worldwide, surveillance of citizens by their governments<br>actually has been conducted for centuries. The SAGE Encyclopedia of<br>Surveillance, Security, and Privacy includes approximately 700<br>articles organized A-Z. The following articles (including word counts)<br>may be of particular interest to criminologists: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-12T08:34:29-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lisbeth Rogers</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;f409e64a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;cd002b7f.1411">   <title>Mailing tomorrow - November UTP Journals Law & Criminology Newsletter </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;cd002b7f.1411</link>   <description> Don't miss the November UTP Journals Law &amp; Criminology Newsletter - mailing<br>tomorrow!<br><br>Sign up for the free monthly UTP Journals Law and Criminology newsletter!<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/lawnewsletter&gt; http://bit.ly/lawnewsletter<br><br>Receive the latest information on newly published research, reviews and<br>opinions as well as Calls for papers and exclusive discounts. Could you pot me touch with a cost effective organisation that could carry out the survey and also with anyone who has experience of conducting such a survey.<br><br>Prof. Roger Matthews<br><br>Sent from my iPhone<br><br>On 27 Oct 2014, at 13:31, &quot;Gillian Meadows&quot; &lt;Gillian.Meadows@MANCHESTER.AC.UK&lt;mailto:Gillian.Meadows@MANCHESTER.AC.UK&gt;&gt; wrote: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-27T11:53:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Roger Matthews</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;98d120bc.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;77cfe2b0.1410">   <title>Book now: Crime Surveys User Conference 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;77cfe2b0.1410</link>   <description> Crime Surveys User Conference 2014<br><br>Monday 8 December 2014<br>Jisc, Brettenham House, London<br><br>This one-day conference, organised by the UK Data Service, will be an opportunity for data producers and research users of the UK crime surveys to gather to discuss data developments, research undertaken and work in progress. Registration fee is \ufffd\ufffd20.<br>Registration will close at Midnight Sunday 19th October.<br>To register your attendance please email: k.j.stockdale@durham.ac.uk.<br>Please find attached the provisional conference programme for the North East Crime Research Network Conference on the 3rd November 2014 at Collingwood College, Durham.<br>As well as the attached programme of speakers we also have some exciting features to announce:<br>After Conference Event (followed by drinks/food at a local establishment)<br>‘Ghosts of Our Future: walking, crime and justice in Durham City’<br>At the end of the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-16T11:51:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>STOCKDALE K.J.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;124fff7e.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;96425b9f.1410">   <title>Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice 56.5 now available on Project MUSE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;96425b9f.1410</link>   <description> Now available on Project MUSE\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice/<br>La Revue canadienne de criminologie et de justice p\ufffd\ufffdnale<br><br>Volume 56, Number 5, October 2014<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/cjccj565pm&gt; http://bit.ly/cjccj565pm<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Aboriginal People and Confidence in the Police<br><br>Liqun Cao<br><br>\ufffd\ufffdpisodes d’inactivit\ufffd\ufffd et revenus criminels dans une trajectoire de<br>d\ufffd\ufffdlinquance1<br><br>Fr\ufffd\ufffdd\ufffd\ufffdric Ouellet, Pierre Tremblay<br><br>A Case Study of the Transformative Effect of Peer Injection Drug Users in<br>the Downtown Eastside of Vancouver, Canada [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-15T10:49:01-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;96425b9f.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;9dc950ed.1410">   <title>2nd Call for Papers: "Security, Control, and Surveillance in the Latin American City" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;9dc950ed.1410</link>   <description> 2nd Call for Papers for the special section: &quot;Security, Control, and<br>Surveillance in the Latin American City&quot;<br><br>urbe: Brazilian Journal of Urban Management<br><br>Guest-editors<br><br>Lucas Melgac\ufffd\ufffdo<br>(Vrije Universiteit Brussel - VUB)<br><br>Nelson Arteaga Botello<br>(Latin American Faculty of Social Sciences - FLACSO)<br><br>Latin American cities are becoming increasingly monitored. The most evident<br>example is the increase in CCTV cameras, both public and private. With the<br>spread of surveillance cameras throughout the urban environment it is<br>becoming nearly impossible for an individual to avoid being digitally<br>recorded while taking a walk along the streets. Surveillance, however, goes<br>far beyond that, as [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-13T12:39:47+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lucas Melga\ufffd\ufffdo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;9dc950ed.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;c358de76.1410">   <title>University of Toronto Law Journal 64.5 is now available online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;c358de76.1410</link>   <description> Now available online...<br><br>University of Toronto Law Journal - Volume 64, Number 5, 2014<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/utlj645&gt; http://bit.ly/utlj645<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Strange bedfellows<br><br>Robert Leckey<br><br>This article addresses important, neglected questions of legal craft in<br>relation to rights challenges to legislation, especially equality claims. It<br>considers the perspective from which to assess multiple parts of a complex<br>scheme in a challenge under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms. Is<br>the challenge best framed against the scheme as a whole \ufffd\ufffd all or nothing \ufffd\ufffd<br>or against the separate parts? The framing or perspective can have serious<br>implications for the outcome. Furthermore, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-10T10:48:47-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;c358de76.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;f9d29b84.1410">   <title>New from Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;f9d29b84.1410</link>   <description> Now available online\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice/<br>La Revue canadienne de criminologie et de justice p\ufffd\ufffdnale<br><br>Volume 56, Number 5, October 2014<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/CJCCJ56_5&gt; http://bit.ly/CJCCJ56_5<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Aboriginal People and Confidence in the Police<br><br>Liqun Cao<br><br>No nationally representative study has been conducted about differential<br>confidence in the police between Aboriginal people and non-Aboriginal<br>persons in Canada. Based on the 2009 General Social Survey of Canada, this<br>article examines the influence of Aboriginal status on confidence in the<br>police. Consistent with the theoretical prediction, results of multiple<br>regression analyses show that Aboriginal people and visible minorities have<br> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-06T10:20:14-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRIMINOLOGY-POSTGRADS;f9d29b84.1410</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
